Pre-Game Insights: Die Mannschaft claimed a 4-2 victory in the quarter-finals of Euro 2012 last time.
Julian Nagelsmann has experienced a relatively mixed start to life in the German hot seat.

Greece are gearing up for their first fixture since March when they were eliminated from Euro 2024 qualifying following a heartbreaking penalty shootout defeat in a playoff semi-final against Georgia.
The visitors will have to be at their best to get something positive from this match.
Florian Wirtz is able to receive the ball against pressure, with a notable ability to break lines with intricate passes.
Georgios Masouras is one of the most lethal and dangerous players in the Greece national team, he plays as a winger and is good with both feet.
The home team have 1.29 odds in favour of them to win the match, 5.50 odds in favour of the match ending in a draw and 9.25 odds in favour of Greece to win the fixture.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Germany score 1.43 goals when playing at home and Greece score 0.5 goals when playing away (on average).
When Germany leads 1-0 at home, they win 33% of their matches.
